summary: Website project for INNO YOUTH, a youth-focused innovation project team focused on creating opportunities and building futures.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive public website for “INNO YOUTH” with clear English copy that describes the group as a youth-focused innovation project team that creates opportunities and builds better futures.

Implement a single-page layout (scrolling sections) that includes, at minimum: Hero (headline + short tagline), About/Mission, What We Do (pillars/values), Projects/Activities (placeholder cards), Team (placeholder member cards), and Contact section.
Add a Contact form that collects name, email, and message, validates required fields, and on submit stores the message in the Motoko backend canister as a “contact submission”.

Choose and apply one coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, button/input styles) appropriate for a youth innovation organization, and enforce it consistently across all sections. Avoid a blue/purple primary palette.

Generate and include required static images in the frontend at `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and render them in the website (logo in header/footer; hero image in hero section; small icon set in “What We Do”).
Replace the current INNO YOUTH logo asset with the user-provided uploaded logo, and update the site to render the new logo in all places where the logo appears (header and footer).

Update the Team section to display exactly these team members and roles: Bennita (Captain), Adith (Vice captain), Devika (Member), anami (Member), esther (Member), franil (Member), roseviya (Member), Anamika (Member).
Update the Team section to display the team member name as “Benitta” (not “Bennita”).

new_feature_requests.summary: Replace the current site logo with the user-provided logo asset (update header/footer rendering accordingly).

Update the Team section to show the specified names and roles: Bennita (captain), Adith (Vice captain), Devika (member), anami (member), esther (member), franil (member), roseviya (member), Anamika (member).
Correct the Team section member name spelling from “Bennita” to “Benitta”.
